name: Fron Haul

reviews.text: We rented a room for two nights in this large seafront house and couldn't have been more happy with it. We had a beautiful large bay window looking out to the sea. Nice size room with a very large bed and a well equipped bathroom as well. Great location in the quaint seaside town of Aberdovey, a nice, clean room. Good value for money and perfect for couples or families.
reviews.title: Great Accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fron Haul is a large seafront house overlooking the Dovey estuary. The home of Reeve and Suzie Warlock – and their two young children, Oliver and Abby – it has two ground floor letting rooms, suitably titles Fore and Aft. We stayed in the front bedroom (Fore), which has lovely views from the large bay window across to the boats moored in the tidal mouth of the river (it’s easy to ignore the small car-park between you and the water!). The room is simple and contemporary and the bathroom, with under-floor heating and king-size shower (large enough to share!) is clean and crisp. Aberdovey has a number of good places to stay - the Llety Bodfor, Sea Breeze, Penhelig Arms, plus a host of quaint self-catering cottages – but at £65 a night (room only – they don’t serve breakfast, but there are plenty of places in the village that do), the Fron Haul represents excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Stylish B&B in Stylish Aberdovey

description: Fron Haul offers luxury, seafront bed & breakfast accommodation in the picturesque village of Aberdovey, with spectacular views over the beautiful Dovey estuary and mountains beyond. Our rates include a choice of breakfasts which are served in your bedroom at a time to suit you. The bedrooms are modern and contemporary having been fully refurbished and offer excellent facilities.
